main_point: The professor explains Implicature and conversational maxims and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes corpus (a process) from implicature (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving syntax and pragmatics.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a student misconception to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for elicitation shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
